newsitem.title: USA: Brunswick to acquire Mongoose bicycle line.
newsitem.headline: Brunswick to acquire Mongoose bicycle line.

text.p: Brunswick Corp said Tuesday it has entered a definitive agreement to purchase the inventory and trademark of the Mongoose bicycle and parts business of Bell Sports Corp.
The price of the purchase is $22 million and also includes a three-year option to acquire up to 600,000 shares of Bell common stock for $7.50 per share, the company said.
Bell shares were down 1/16 at 5-5/16 Tuesday. Brunswick shares were down 1/8 at 26-3/4.

The business, with about $60 million in annual sales, markets a complete line of bicycles, including BMX, mountain, cross and road models, under the Mongoose brand name, and distributes bicycle parts and accessories, including the Advent line of products, Brunswick said.
"... this acquisition gives us a strong presence in the BMX market and in the independent bicycle dealer distribution channel," Brunswick chief executive officer Peter Larson said in a news release.
The transaction is expected to close in early May, subject to customary closing conditions and Hart-Scott-Rodino filing requirements, the recreation products company said.
The option agreement reflects potential for future marketing alliances between the two companies, Brunswick said.
